etymons.notes: tuh tuh cf. Lane 319: a cry by which one chides the camel

Preterit.turoyo: aḥna kulan mtahtáhle-lan b-i=briṯo 802; 57/120; naḥət w mlelequmṣadrekefe w rahəṭlakkalbe (...) mtahtahleakkalbe
translations: hat er alle in alle Welt
'He went down and gathered some stones in front of his chest and ran towards the dogs. He dispersed the dogs.'
